com.beowulfe.hap

Interface HomekitAccessory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BasicThermostat, ColorfulLightbulb, CoolingThermostat, DimmableLightbulb, Fan, GarageDoor, HeatingThermostat, HorizontalTiltingWindowCovering, HumiditySensor, Lightbulb, LockableLockMechanism, LockMechanism, Outlet, Switch, TemperatureSensor, Thermostat, VerticalTiltingWindowCovering, WindowCovering

    public interface HomekitAccessory
    Base interface for all Homekit Accessories. You can implement this interface directly, but most users will prefer to use the more full featured interfaces in com.beowulfe.hap.accessories which include a default implementation of getServices().
    Author:
    Andy Lintner

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getId()
      A unique identifier that must remain static across invocations to prevent errors with paired iOS devices.
      String getLabel()
      Returns a label to display in iOS.
      String getManufacturer()
      Returns a manufacturer to display in iOS.
      String getModel()
      Returns a model name to display in iOS.
      String getSerialNumber()
      Returns a serial number to display in iOS.
      Collection<Service> getServices()
      The collection of Services this accessory supports.
      void identify()
      Performs an operation that can be used to identify the accessory.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        int getId()
        A unique identifier that must remain static across invocations to prevent errors with paired iOS devices. When used as a child of a Bridge, this value must be greater than 1, as that ID is reserved for the Bridge itself.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier.

      • getLabel

        String getLabel()
        Returns a label to display in iOS.
        Returns:
        the label.

      • identify

        void identify()
        Performs an operation that can be used to identify the accessory. This action can be performed without pairing.

      • getSerialNumber

        String getSerialNumber()
        Returns a serial number to display in iOS.
        Returns:
        the serial number, or null.

      • getModel

        String getModel()
        Returns a model name to display in iOS.
        Returns:
        the model name, or null.

      • getManufacturer

        String getManufacturer()
        Returns a manufacturer to display in iOS.
        Returns:
        the manufacturer, or null.

      • getServices

        Collection<Service> getServices()
        The collection of Services this accessory supports. Services are the primary way to interact with the accessory via Homekit. Besides the Services offered here, the accessory will automatically include the required information service. This method will only be useful if you're implementing your own accessory type. For the standard accessories, use the default implementation provided by the interfaces in com.beowulfe.hap.accessories.
        Returns:
        the collection of services.
